intro: Acrostichum luteum, commonly known as the yellow hibiscus, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, yellow-orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a waxy texture. It thrives in humid, sunny environments and is often used in ornamental gardening.
